Egypt's Hosni Mubarak on life support amid crisis

Egypt's ousted leader was being kept alive by life support after he suffered a stroke in prison Tuesday, officials said, deepening the country's uncertainty just as a potentially explosive fight opened over who will succeed him. (AP)
  • 6/2 Mubarak sentenced  |  His trial  |  From hero to convict

Mass. Senate OK's $49m for ailing MBTA

Senators agreed to tap money from a little-known state surplus to help the MBTA close its deficit for the coming year and avoid steeper fare increases. (Boston Globe)

Heat advisory for parts of area on Wed.

While Logan Airport might not reach 90 degrees Wednesday, Thursday and Friday to qualify for a heat wave, many places in the area might, meteorologist David Epstein writes. (Boston.com)
